TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit InternetAddress extends System.Object

Docs.summary: An internet address, as specified by rfc0822.

remarks.para: A can be any type of address defined by the original Internet Message specification.
There are effectively two (2) types of addresses: mailboxes and groups.
Mailbox addresses are what are most commonly known as email addresses and are represented by the class.

Group addresses are themselves lists of addresses and are represented by the class. While rare, it is still important to handle these types of addresses. They typically only contain mailbox addresses, but may also contain other group addresses.

Docs.remarks: Initializes the and properties of the internet address.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Text.Encoding Encoding { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Text.Encoding Encoding

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the character encoding to use when encoding the name of the address.
Docs.remarks: The character encoding is used to convert the property, if it is set, to a stream of bytes when encoding the internet address for transport.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Name { get; set; }
.property instance string Name

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the address.
Docs.remarks: A name is optional and is typically set to the name of the person or group that own the internet address.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string ToString (bool encode);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ToString(bool encode) cil managed

Docs.param: If set to true, the will be encoded.
Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the , optionally encoding it for transport.

remarks.para: If the parameter is true, then this method will return an encoded version of the internet address according to the rules described in rfc2047.
However, if the parameter is false, then this method will return a string suitable only for display purposes.
